bibl.title: Letter from Marshall L. Price to Howard A. Kelly, February 4, 1908

div1.p: Price requests that Kelly make a deposition in support of a pension for Jennie Carroll.

div1.head: Letter from Marshall L. Price to Howard A. Kelly, February 4, 1908
div1.opener:
MARSHALL LANGTON PRICE, M.D., SECRETARY
State Board of Health
OF MARYLAND
8 AND 10 SOUTH STREET
BALTIMORE, February 4th, 1908.
DR. WM. H. WELCH, PRESIDENT
DR. EUGENE JONES
DR. LOUIS A. GRIFFITH
DR. JAMES BOSLEY
MR. DOUGLAS H. THOMAS, JR.
HON. WM. S. BRYAN, JR.
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
My dear Dr. Kelly:--
div1.p:
As you no doubt know Senator Dick has introduced a bill to
give Mrs. Carroll a pension of $125 per month. It seems that before
these bills can be acted upon it is necessary to deposit depositions
with the Committee on Military Affairs. Mrs. Carroll suggested that
you might be willing to make one of these depositions. If you can
conveniently arrange it, I will very much appreciate it. I enclose
the deposition which I took out this morning. If you can take out the
second deposition, will you either return it by messenger or address
it to Mrs. James Carroll, 1432 Clifton St., Washington, D.C.
